result.execSummary:
The defendant Mario A Pegues was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Strangulation and Suffocation [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(1).
  • Intimidate Victim/Use or Attempt Force [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.45(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Kenosha County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed (at least 30hrs/wk) or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
Spend 10 months in the county jail, commencing forthwith.  Huber privileges are allowed.  Credit for 177 days served.  Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to establish paternity and/or to pay child support and make all court appearances in any paternity action.  May not have contact with Andrea Parise, unless otherwise permitted by the agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

timeConds.notes: TO COMMENCE FORTHWITH.  w/Huber privileges.  Credit for 177 days served.
